p: Some such scientists now characterise the 2 °C of warming of global temperature as a planetary threshold that, if crossed, will push the Earth System onto an irreversible pathway towards “Hothouse Earth” (Steffen et al. 2018). A call for declaring a climate emergency (Lenton et al. 2019) is, in this respect, a political attempt by scientists to warn about how little time is left to avoid such a catastrophic scenario. A problem is however that there is little attention paid to the human societies, which are seen as an integral part of the Earth System (Steffen et al. 2020). Like a well-known German sociologist Ulrich Beck (2010) said: “If ‘the environment’ only includes everything which is not human, not social, then the concept is sociologically empty.”
